page.title: 16WARMINSTER'S FAMILIES OFFICE
page.content: Battlesbury Barracks is a big Army camp on the outskirts of Warminster. To help soldiers with problems, the Barracks has a Families Office, the lieutenant who helps to run the Office, has a lot of Army experience, as he joined up when he was 15 and has served for 25 years, being posted all around the world. In the Office he deals with soldiers of all ages and with all sorts of problems, from financial matters to marriage problems. This work is confidential. Because the lieutenant travels round with the same Battalion and lives in the Barracks, he gets to know the people well. Officially his Office is open from 8 am to 5 pm, but he is always on call to deal with emergencies, and one morning he was called out at 3 am!
